Medium: Oil on paper, mounted on wood
Credit Line: Bequest of Miss Adelaide Milton de Groot (1876-1967), 1967
Description: Lola de Valence was widely known as a dancer and one-time Manet model. The sitter's stylized coiffure and facial features still reflect Modigliani's early, simplified sculptures. The muted palette and nondescript setting reveal the artist's cautious beginnings with painting.
Provenance: probably sold in January 1940, for $650, to Valentine)
probably stock no. 2044c, sold in January 1940, for $980, to de Groot]
Adelaide Milton de Groot, New York (probably by 1940–d. 1967
